meanings.definition: Teaselling (verb): to raise the nap of (cloth) by dressing with teasels.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys teaselling the fabric to make it softer.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was teaselling the material to give it a fluffy texture.
meanings.sent3: After teaselling the cloth, it felt like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her gentle teaselling transformed the rough fabric into a velvety masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The teaselling process made the material look like a field of soft grass.

meanings.definition: Teaselling (noun): the act or process of teaselling cloth.
meanings.sent1: The teaselling of the fabric was done meticulously.
meanings.sent2: Teaselling is an important step in fabric preparation.
meanings.sent3: During teaselling, the cloth seemed to dance under the teasels.
meanings.sent4: The teaselling machine hummed as it worked on the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The teaselling process gave the cloth a unique texture.
